0.snippet: The reversal of the Chevron doctrine "may make deregulation under the new Trump administration less robust than markets expect," Barry Gilbert said.
0.content:
A recent Supreme Court ruling may slow down President-elect Donald Trump's deregulation plans.

The overturning of the Chevron doctrine in June limits federal agencies' power.

Deregulation delays could disappoint investors who've been pricing in less red tape since Trump's win.

A recent Supreme Court decision could hinder one of the stock market's biggest reasons for rallying around Donald Trump's coming second term in office.

Trump's election win in November excited Wall Street over the idea that a wave of deregulation was set to unleash gains for American businesses.

But the Supreme Court's June decision to overturn the so-called Chevron doctrine could hinder the Trump administration's deregulatory agenda, strategists at Carson Group said this week.

The Chevron doctrine was a decadeslong legal precedent dating back to 1984 that empowered federal government agencies to interpret laws when legislation passed by Congress was ambiguous.

The Supreme Court's precedent, set during the Ronald Reagan administration, was that courts should defer to the agencies rather than make their own judgment in such instances.

But since the precedent was overturned in June, courts are now dismissing federal agencies' interpretations of ambiguous laws.

This was on full display earlier this week when the Sixth Circuit Court of Appeals struck down net-neutrality rules.

The three-judge panel specifically highlighted the downfall of the Chevron doctrine in their ruling.

"Unlike past challenges that the D.C. Circuit considered under Chevron, we no longer afford deference to the FCC's reading of the statute," the decision said.

Barry Gilbert, an investment strategist at Carson Group, said in a note on Friday that the Chevron doctrine was initially supported by conservative justices in 1984 "because it made deregulation easier."

"Overturning Chevron was great (from a Republican perspective) when Democrats are in power, but it also makes deregulation more difficult, which is why the original Chevron case went to the Supreme Court in the first place," Gilbert said.

With Republicans set to hold a trifecta of power in the White House and both chambers of Congress later this month, the overturning of the Chevron doctrine could come back to bite them when it comes to enacting policies aimed at loosening regulations for the private sector, Gilbert said.

"Some efforts to lighten regulatory requirements are likely to be met with waves of litigation that may take years to work their way through the court system," Gilbert said.

What could have been swift deregulation policies enacted by President-elect Trump could now take much longer to play out as lawsuits inevitably make their way before the courts.

"We are worse off than the Reagan administration was before the Chevron ruling, because courts will be drawn into the messy process of delineating exactly what the new ruling means," Gilbert said.

In a December note, UBS said that after the overturning of the Chevron doctrine, certain efforts to cut spending could also be impeded.

"The ruling also makes it harder to cut spending in areas that are well-defined in legislation," UBS said.

UBS said that could impact the efforts of the newly formed Department of Government Efficiency, which seeks to significantly shrink the footprint of federal agencies. Eliminating entire agencies such as the Department of Education would require 60 votes in the Senate.

While deregulation is still on the table during Trump's second administration, it could ultimately happen much slower than during his first administration, which could set the stock market up for disappointment.

"It may make deregulation under the new Trump administration less robust than markets expect in places," Gilbert said.

1.title: Is DeAndre Hopkins playing today vs Broncos? Latest on Chiefs WR's status for Week 18
1.snippet: The Kansas City Chiefs have adopted the "keep on keeping on" mantra this year, not quite steamrolling their way to the top of the AFC, but sending a message...
1.content:
The Kansas City Chiefs have adopted the "keep on keeping on" mantra this year, not quite steamrolling their way to the top of the AFC, but sending a message about their Super Bowl credentials regardless. With a first-round bye safely in the locker, the Chiefs have the luxury of resting multiple starters, especially given how banged up the team has been all year.

Ad

Coach Andy Reid confirmed several starters including Patrick Mahomes, Travis Kelce, Isiah Pacheco and Kareem Hunt won't play. That list, however, does not include DeAndre Hopkins, their star mid-season acquisition.

70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now

Is DeAndre Hopkins playing today vs the Denver Broncos?

In Mahomes' absence, Carson Wentz will start under center, and the former Philadelphia Eagles quarterback must make sure he gets the ball to Hopkins this evening for one reason: Hopkins is eligible for a $750K bonus if he meets certain milestones in the regular-season finale.

Ad

Trending

Looking to predict NFL playoff Scenarios? Try our NFL Playoff Predictor for real-time simulations and stay ahead of the game!

Hopkins will get $250K if he scores a touchdown tonight and will get an additional $250K each if he racks up 9+ receptions and 140+ receiving yards. The latter two may sound a little out of reach but we'll find out when the Chiefs take on the Broncos at Empower Field for a 4:25 pm kickoff this evening.

One thing to note here is that the Denver Broncos defense, which held strong for most of the season, has struggled over the past two weeks. They allowed the Los Angeles Chargers and Cincinnati Bengals to rack up 30+ points in consecutive weeks, so there may be an opening for the Chiefs to pick up their 16th win.

Ad

Expand Tweet

Ad

Where Kansas City Chiefs stand in Week 18

There will be a lot of football being played before we see Patrick Mahomes and Travis Kelce take the field again. When they do, the Chiefs will be in the Divisional Round of the playoffs. Technically, they could face one of seven teams - Texans, Bills, Ravens, Chargers, Steelers, Broncos, Bengals/Dolphins.

While it's still too early to say who they will face exactly, you can always try your hand at predicting the playoff bracket with our free NFL Playoff Predictor.

2.title: What happened to Jordan Love? QB on the sidelines during Packers-Bears
2.snippet: The Green Bay Packers' playoff preparations hit a snag during Sunday's Week 18 matchup against the Chicago Bears.
2.content:
The Green Bay Packers' playoff preparations hit a snag during Sunday's Week 18 matchup against the Chicago Bears. Jordan Love left the game in the second quarter with a right elbow injury, casting a shadow over the team's postseason aspirations.

Ad

The quarterback exited with 13:23 remaining in the second quarter after completing a short pass to Josh Jacobs. The injury occurred when he took a hit in the backfield following the throw. Medical staff immediately began evaluating his right elbow on the sideline.

Expand Tweet

Ad

Trending

70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now

The Packers' medical team listed Love as questionable to return. Backup QB Malik Willis stepped in to replace him, leading the offense to its first touchdown of the game shortly after taking the field.

Looking to predict NFL playoff Scenarios? Try our NFL Playoff Predictor for real-time simulations and stay ahead of the game!

This injury raises concerns for Green Bay, who had already secured its spot in the NFC wild card round. A prolonged absence for Love could severely impact the Packers' chances in the upcoming road playoff game.

The timing couldn't be worse for Green Bay, as Love wasn't the only casualty of the day. Wide receiver Christian Watson also left the game in the second quarter with an apparent knee injury, requiring a cart to transport him to the locker room.

Ad

LaFleur's decision-making under scrutiny after Jordan Love's injury

NFL: Chicago Bears at Green Bay Packers - Source: Imagn

Packers coach Matt LaFleur faces tough questions about his choice to play starters in a game with minimal playoff implications. The decision to keep Jordan Love and other key players on the field has sparked debate among fans and analysts.

Ad

The ripple effects of these injuries could reshape Green Bay's playoff strategy. Watson's speed and size make him Love's primary deep threat in the passing game. His absence would allow opposing defenses to press coverage more aggressively.

Willis represents the Packers' only backup option at QB. While capable, he lacks playoff experience. The drop-off from Love to Willis could prove significant in high-stakes playoff matchups.

LaFleur's management of his roster continues to raise eyebrows. Even after losing Love and Watson, running back Josh Jacobs remained in the game taking carries. This persistence with playing starters might force Green Bay to navigate the playoffs without its offensive cornerstones.

3.title: Week 18 Kansas City Chiefs injury report feat. Patrick Mahomes, Isiah Pacheco, and more
3.snippet: The Broncos will host the Chiefs in their regular season finale in a game that will decide if Denver will snap their eighth-year postseason drought this...
3.content:
The Broncos will host the Chiefs in their regular season finale in a game that will decide if Denver will snap their eighth-year postseason drought this year.

Ad

While the Broncos have a postseason berth on the line in Week 18, their opponent, the Chiefs, have already locked up the top seed in the AFC and have secured a first-round bye in the playoffs. As a result, the team will be sitting Patrick Mahomes and several other starters in Week 18.

Below, we will take a look at the Chiefs' injury report ahead of their regular season finale at Empower Field.

Ad

Trending

Expand Tweet

Ad

Looking to predict NFL playoff Scenarios? Try our NFL Playoff Predictor for real-time simulations and stay ahead of the game!

Chiefs' injury report for Week 18

The Kansas City Chiefs listed four players as out for their Week 18 trip to Denver on their final injury report: offensive tackle Jawaan Taylor (knee), running back Isiah Pacheco (rib), cornerback Jaylen Watson (ankle), and wide receiver Mecole Hardman (knee).

Pacheco, who had already missed significant time earlier in the season due to a fractured fibula, will not play in the regular season finale, but he should be healthy for the playoffs, head coach Andy Reid noted on Monday.

Ad

"He'll be available playoff-wise. I'll probably hold him back this week in practice just a bit so he can be fresh and ready to go," the veteran coach said.

Reid also hinted that Watson (ankle) and Hardman (knee) would make a comeback during the playoffs, but he seemed more confident about the receiver's swift recovery than that of the cornerback.

The Chiefs gave us an idea of the key players they will be resting against the Denver Broncos in Week 18 based on their final injury report. Although no player was given the questionable designation by the team, several starters were given the doubtful label.

Ad

Giving a player the doubtful tag usually indicates that they are more likely to not play than to do so. Most of the players who were assigned that designation on the team's final injury report are injury-free. However, these are key players who will most likely be rested for the Broncos game on Sunday.

Expand Tweet

The players the team deemed doubtful for the regular season finale are listed here: quarterback Patrick Mahomes (ankle/rest/coach's decision), defensive lineman Chris Jones (calf/rest/coach's decision), linebacker Nick Bolton (rest/coach's decision), running back Kareem Hunt (rest/coach's decision), defensive end George Karlaftis (rest/coach's decision), tight end Travis Kelce (rest/coach's decision), safety Justin Reid (rest/coach's decision), and linebacker Drue Tranquill (rest/coach's decision).

4.title: Are Commanders resting starters? Latest on Washington's plans for Week 18 vs Cowboys

4.content:
The Washington Commanders will travel to face the Dallas Cowboys in Week 18 of the 2024-25 NFL season. Sunday's matchup between the two NFC East teams will kick off at 1 p.m. EST from AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Dallas.

Ad

Since the Commanders have already secured a playoff berth, fans have been curious to learn whether they will rest their starters for the regular-season finale.

Are the Commanders resting starters for Week 18 vs. Cowboys?

Washington Commanders QB Jayden Daniels - Source: Getty

As things stand, the Commanders will field their starters against the Cowboys on Sunday. Commanders coach Dan Quinn wants his players to carry forward the momentum heading into the playoffs.

Ad

Trending

“We’re going to go after [it] as hard as we can." Quinn said earlier in the week. "I think the seeding portion of this is really important, and that’s what we discussed as a team. We thought [in Week 17] the vibe was awesome at the game.

“We thought we left some plays out there, and so for us that leveling up as we’re heading into this week with Dallas would be really important. But we recognize having a six seed and going into the playoffs with that is a good thing. And so, we’re going to fight like hell to keep that.”

Ad

Hence, Washington's quarterback Jayden Daniels, wideout Terry McLaurin and other key starters will play against Dallas. However, the Commanders will want to secure a sizable lead in the game to replace some of their starters and avoid unnecessary injuries.

The Commanders currently hold the No. 6 seed in the NFC. They can maintain that position for the postseason if they beat the Cowboys on Sunday.

If the Commanders lose against Dallas and the Packers beat the Bears, Washington will drop to the No. 7 seed.

Ad

How to watch Washington Commanders vs Dallas Cowboys? TV schedule and live stream details for Week 18 game

The Commanders vs. Cowboys Week 18 game will be broadcast live on Fox, where Adam Amin (play-by-play) and Mark Sanchez (analysis) will be in the announcers' booth. Kristina Pink will report on the contest from the sidelines.

Fans can also live stream the Commanders-Cowboys game on Fubo.

5.title: Why is Derek Carr not playing? Latest on Saints QB ahead of Week 18 clash vs Buccaneers
5.snippet: Derek Carr has been much talked about ahead of the Week 18 clash between the New Orleans Saints and Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
5.content:
Derek Carr has been much talked about ahead of the Week 18 clash between the New Orleans Saints and Tampa Bay Buccaneers. The quarterback has been ruled out of the regular season finale and fans want to know the reason why Carr won't suit up on Sunday.

Ad

Why is Derek Carr not playing in Week 18?

NFL: New Orleans Saints QB Derek Carr - Source: Imagn

70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now

Derek Carr was ruled out against Tampa Bay due to a left-hand injury. The QB did not participate in any Saints practice session during the week.

Ad

Trending

Looking to predict NFL playoff Scenarios? Try our NFL Playoff Predictor for real-time simulations and stay ahead of the game!

Carr injured his hand in the fourth quarter of New Orleans' 14-11 win over the New York Giants in Week 14. He collided with teammate Kevin Austin Jr., after jumping in an attempt to get a first down. Carr landed awkwardly on his head and hand, injuring himself on the play. He exited and was replaced by Spencer Riddler.

The Saints later announced that Carr had multiple fractures in his left hand and was ruled out for the rest of the season. In Carr's absence, Riddler has started as New Orleans' signal-caller and he will lead the team's offense against the Buccaneers.

Ad

Since the Saints are not headed to the playoffs, Carr is expected to return to action next season.

How has Derek Carr performed this season?

Derek Carr's 2024 season was marred by injury. Nonetheless, he completed 189 of 279 passes for 2,145 yards and 15 touchdowns with five interceptions. He also recorded 71 yards and a rushing TD across 10 games.

Carr missed a few games earlier in the season due to an oblique injury. The four-time Pro Bowler finished with a 5-5 record.

Ad

6.snippet: The Dallas Cowboys will face the Washington Commanders at AT&T Stadium in Week 18 to wrap up their dismal 2024 NFL season.
6.content:
The Dallas Cowboys will face the Washington Commanders at AT&T Stadium in Week 18 to wrap up their dismal 2024 NFL season. The Cowboys lost to the Philadelphia Eagles 41-7 last time out, with wide receiver CeeDee Lamb out. Now, fans are wondering if he will return for Sunday's regular season finale.

Ad

Expand Tweet

Ad

Trending

Exploring CeeDee Lamb's availability status for Week 18

70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now

CeeDee Lamb will miss the season's last game against the Washington Commanders. The star wide receiver has been dealing with an AC joint sprain in his shoulder since the Week 9 game against the Atlanta Falcons, but he persisted in playing through the injury.

Looking to predict NFL playoff Scenarios? Try our NFL Playoff Predictor for real-time simulations and stay ahead of the game!

Lamb's shoulder issue was aggravated in Week 16 when the Cowboys faced off against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. Following that game, Dallas issued a statement announcing that the 25-year-old wide receiver would not play in the final two games of the season after undergoing shoulder scans and testing.

Ad

Lamb will go through a course of rehabilitation and treatment on his shoulder, but surgery is not currently expected, the team said.

Defensive back Kemon Hall will also not play on Sunday. He's dealing with a hamstring injury and didn't practice during the week before the team ruled him out on the final injury report on Friday.

Linebacker Nick Vigil (foot), defensive tackle Mazi Smith (pelvis), safety Donovan Wilson (knee) and guard Chuma Edoga (toe) were also ruled questionable on the Cowboys' final injury report.

Ad

Expand Tweet

Ad

How has CeeDee Lamb performed this season?

CeeDee Lamb, who became the second-best paid wide receiver in the NFL after signing a four-year, $136 million extension in August, has been one of the league's most productive wideouts this season despite having to play through a shoulder ailment at one point.

Before being shut down for the season, the star receiver recorded 101 receptions (tied for second in the league) from 152 targets (second in the league). He also amassed 1,194 receiving yards and six receiving touchdowns.

Lamb joined Michael Thomas and Brandon Marshall as the only NFL players to record 100 catches in three of their first five seasons. Additionally, his 496 catches in his first five NFL seasons are only second to Thomas' 510 in league history.

Earlier in the week, Bills coach Sean McDermott said his starters practiced well for the challenge at New England.

"They’ve been rather focused,” McDermott said. “I’m sure some are appreciating the rest and being able to unplug a bit but not totally getting out of the routines, which I think is also important.

“There’s a lot of things you balance; you want to win the game and trying to be smart with keeping players healthy. There’s other considerations, player incentives, players on the practice squad. I’m trying to balance that, and I think communication’s big, and you try trying to do the best you can.”

Ad

The Bills will want to keep their main starters healthy and fit for the playoffs. Thus, it's possible that quarterback Josh Allen, running back James Cook and others could be replaced by their backups at some time in the game against the Patriots.

The Bills currently have the No. 2 seed in the AFC. They cannot get the top seed, so there isn't much to play for on Sunday. However, a win will keep Buffalo's momentum heading into the postseason.

Ad

How to watch Bills vs. Patriots? TV schedule and live stream details for Week 18 contest

The Bills vs. Patriots (3-13) game will be broadcast live on CBS, where Spero Dedes (play-by-play) and Adam Archuleta (analysis) will be in the announcers' booth. Aditi Kinkhabwala will report from the sidelines.

Fans can also livestream the Bills-Patriots matchup on Paramount+ or Fubo.

Date: Sunday, Jan. 5, 2025

Time: 1 p.m. ET

TV channel: CBS

Live stream: Paramount+ or Fubo

Venue: Gillette Stadium in Foxborough, Massachusetts

8.title: What do Bengals need to make the playoffs? Where Joe Burrow and co. stand after Week 18 win vs. Steelers
8.snippet: The Bengals defeated the Steelers 19-17 in their final game of the 2024 NFL regular season to finish with a 9-8 record. It is a welcome relief for a team...
8.content:
The Bengals defeated the Steelers 19-17 in their final game of the 2024 NFL regular season to finish with a 9-8 record. It is a welcome relief for a team that was 4-8 at one point. They won five straight games to end the season and will feel they have some momentum going into the playoffs if they can get there.

Ad

Because despite winning this matchup and finishing with a winning record, Cincinnati has not punched its postseason ticket yet. Their early losses ensured that they finished just one game above 0.500 and now they will need help from other teams to ensure that they can make it past the regular season. Therefore, there is not much the Bengals can do other than hope.

Bengals' playoff chances after defeating Cardinals 19-17

70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now

The reason the Bengals need favors from other teams is because the Broncos have a 9-7 record. They need to lose to the Kansas City Chiefs Sunday afternoon to finish with an identical 9-8 record to Cincinnati. If their records are tied, Joe Burrow and company will have the advantage since they defeated Denver in their Week 17 matchup and thus have a better head-to-head record in the tiebreaker.

Ad

Trending

Looking to predict NFL playoff Scenarios? Try our NFL Playoff Predictor for real-time simulations and stay ahead of the game!

However, that is not all that the Bengals need. Miami currently has an 8-8 record and knows that they can get into the playoffs if they defeat the Jets and the Chiefs beat the Broncos. In that case, they will also have an identical 9-8 record to Cincinnati, but they hold the tiebreaker over Denver.

Therefore, for the Bengals to make the postseason, the Broncos need to lose their game to the Chiefs, and the Dolphins must either tie or lose against the Jets. Both of them are tough asks because Kansas City is likely to rest its starters because they have already clinched the top seed in the AFC, and New York is one of the worst teams in the NFL with a 4-12 record. Therefore, Cincinnati's chances of making it past the regular season are still very low.

Ad

Expand Tweet

Ad

Bengals' playoff scenario amid 9-8 record

Sportskeeda's Playoff Predictor only serves to reinforce that. We ran a simulation and we finished with the Broncos taking the final seventh seed, whereas the Bengals and the Dolphins missed out.

Sportskeeda Playoff Predictor Scenario

In this scenario, both Denver and Miami won against their opponents, which is likely given what we have identified before. However, there is some reason for hope too for Cincinnati.

Ad

The Chiefs might be playing their backups, but they would be hungry to prove their worth. Additionally, they are the two-time Super Bowl champions and current AFC top seed. Andy Reid is one of the smartest coaches out there and he will be looking to win this game. Last year, he rested his players in the final match against the Chargers too, and eked out a 13-12 win.

Similarly, the Dolphins might be favorites to beat the Jets but they might have to do so without Tua Tagovailoa, who is doubtful for this game. He is battling a hip injury and his production might be down even if he features. Miami really does not have a good alternative to their starting quarterback and New York might be fired up to finish this season on a high in their home stadium.

Ad

Expand Tweet

Therefore, the Bengals are not quite out yet. However, they need a lot of things to fall into place tomorrow to make it to the playoffs as the seventh seed. And whichever team has the pleasure of doing so will only find the road ahead tougher as they would have to travel to Buffalo to face Josh Allen and the second-seeded Bills.

9.title: Is Justin Herbert playing today vs Raiders? Exploring Chargers QB's status for Week 18
9.snippet: Not many expected the Los Angeles Chargers to be here in Week 18. With 10 wins heading into their regular-season finale, it appears Jim Harbaugh has...
9.content:
Not many expected the Los Angeles Chargers to be here in Week 18. With 10 wins heading into their regular-season finale, it appears Jim Harbaugh has breathed new life into a franchise that just never appeared to be heading in the direction of contention under former head coach Brandon Staley. With Justin Herbert in tow, the Chargers impressed most NFL fans despite losing big names like Keenan Allen and Mike Williams.

Ad

And now here we are. The Chargers are the fifth seed in the AFC but haven't quite locked it up just yet. They will have an opportunity to do so when they take on the Las Vegas Raiders later this evening and clearly have no plans to rest Herbert as they begin their pursuit of an 11th win.

NFL: Los Angeles Chargers at New England Patriots - Source: Imagn

70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now

Looking to predict NFL playoff Scenarios? Try our NFL Playoff Predictor for real-time simulations and stay ahead of the game!

Is Justin Herbert playing today vs the Las Vegas Raiders?

The Chargers have eight names on the Week 18 injury report but Justin Herbert is not one of them. Expect to see a lot of Herbert as the Chargers look to lock up the fifth seed in the AFC.

Ad

Trending

However, wide receiver Josh Palmer will play no part tonight due to a foot injury. Running back Gus Edwards is also out with an ankle injury.

Will Los Angeles Chargers rest starters for Week 18 vs Raiders?

In a nutshell, no. Jim Harbaugh made it clear that the team is looking to go all-in to put their name across as the fifth seed in the conference.

Ad

“We’re playing to move up,” Harbaugh told the Associated Press. “We’d love to be in the fifth seed. That gives you a chance to have a playoff game at home, even in the divisional round. That’s where things stand for us, the plan for us is to win. That’s been the mindset from the beginning.”

A loss to the Chargers will see them take home the sixth seed since Pittsburgh already lost to Cincinnati last night. If they beat the Raiders, they will have to travel to Houston to take on the Texans, who have locked up the No. 4 seed in the AFC.

0.title: Advisory: Chevron to Present at Goldman Sachs Energy, CleanTech & Utilities Conference 2025
0.snippet: Mike Wirth, Chairman and CEO of Chevron Corporation (NYSE: CVX), will take part in the Goldman Sachs Energy, CleanTech & Utilities Conference 2025.
0.content:
HOUSTON--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Mike Wirth, Chairman and CEO of Chevron Corporation (NYSE: CVX), will take part in the Goldman Sachs Energy, CleanTech & Utilities Conference 2025 on Wednesday, January 8, 2025, at 9:00 AM ET, discussing corporate strategy and the company’s primary objective of delivering higher returns, lower carbon and superior shareholder value in any business environment.

Please visit here to view a live webcast of the conversation.

Chevron is one of the world’s leading integrated energy companies. We believe affordable, reliable and ever-cleaner energy is essential to enabling human progress. Chevron produces crude oil and natural gas; manufactures transportation fuels, lubricants, petrochemicals and additives; and develops technologies that enhance our business and the industry. We aim to grow our oil and gas business, lower the carbon intensity of our operations and grow lower carbon businesses in renewable fuels, carbon capture and offsets, hydrogen and other emerging technologies. More information about Chevron is available at www.chevron.com.

1.title: ODU Men's Basketball Wins Sun Belt Thriller Over Southern Miss, 74-71
1.snippet: Jaden Johnson made a driving layup with 36 seconds remaining in the second half to put ODU up 71-68 before three clutch free throws by Sean Durugordon sealed...
1.content:
NORFOLK, Va. - Jaden Johnson made a driving layup with 36 seconds remaining in the second half to put ODU up 71-68 before three clutch free throws by Sean Durugordon sealed the victory, 74-71 for Old Dominion men's basketball on Saturday afternoon at Chartway Arena against Southern Miss.

Old Dominion is now 6-9 overall and 2-1 in the Sun Belt. The defeat brings Southern Miss to a record of 6-9 and 1-2 in the Sun Belt.

In the first half, neither side could find a definitive edge. USM got out to a seven-point lead at the 9:49 mark after a made layup by Deantoni Gordon. ODU fought back and grabbed its first lead of the game at the 5:27 mark after a Robert Davis Jr. three and a made free throw. Davis finished the first half with 12 points and two threes while Durugordon finished the first half with 11 points.

USM’s Andre Curbelo scored a team high 10 points and five assists. USM shot 58% from deep in the first half, whereas ODU shot 54% from the field and scored more bench points (10-to-3), and paint points (16-to-10).

The second half was back-and-forth, with ODU grabbing a three-point lead (45-42) at the 18:18 mark through a Stephaun Walker layup. USM was able to snatch back the lead, 48-46, at the 14:58 mark after a Curbelo fast break layup. The Golden Eagles stretched their lead to five at 12:05 after three second-chance free throws from Alfred Worrell Jr. scored it 55-50. The Monarchs fought the deficit back and regained the lead 56-55 after a tip-in layup by Caelum Swanton Rodger went in at 8:03. Christian Watson gave Southern Miss its final lead of the night with a three, 63-62, but Jaden Johnson retook the lead for ODU and Stephaun Walker stretched the lead to 66-63. With the score tied at 68, Johnson made a driving layup and was fouled to give ODU a 71-68 lead after hitting the foul shot. Durugordon hit a trio of foul shots down the stretch to secure the Monarch win.

Davis led the Monarchs in scoring with 18 points on the night and matched his career high in assists (4). Durugordon finished with 16 points, a team leading nine rebounds, he went 8-11 from the charity stripe and had a career high four steals. Johnson played all but 30 seconds in the win and had a career high nine assists and with one turnover. Caelum Swanton-Rodger matched his career high 12 points tonight and grabbed eight boards. R.J. Blakney played 27 minutes and shot 75% from the field.

As a team, Old Dominion shot 46% from the field (25-54), 76% from the stripe (22-29), and grabbed 32 rebounds - 10 of which were offensive rebounds. ODU scored 32 points in the paint, 16 off turnovers by USM. Old Dominion found victory despite only shooting 11.8% from deep (2-17). ODU had to be successful around the margins of the game, because USM shot 52.6% from deep (10-19) and shot 45% from the field (23-51). The Golden Eagles grabbed 34 rebounds.

Old Dominion will get ready for a two-game road trip down south for Sun Belt Conference action, battling Louisiana in Lafayette before heading to Mobile, Alabama to take on South Alabama.

3.title: Is Jerome Ford playing today? Browns RB's status revealed for Week 18 vs. Ravens
3.snippet: The Cleveland Browns will conclude their challenging and disappointing 2024 season on Saturday against familiar opponents, the Baltimore Ravens,...
3.content:
The Cleveland Browns will conclude their challenging and disappointing 2024 season on Saturday against familiar opponents, the Baltimore Ravens, at M&T Bank Stadium.

Ad

Ahead of their Week 18 showdown, the Browns revealed on Thursday the game status of several players, including Jerome Ford, who sustained an ankle injury against the Miami Dolphins last week.

Expand Tweet

Ad

Trending

70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now

Exploring Jerome Ford's availability for Week 18

Jerome Ford won't be available for the Cleveland Browns in their final game of the 2024 season after the team ruled him out on their injury report on Thursday.

Looking to predict NFL playoff Scenarios? Try our NFL Playoff Predictor for real-time simulations and stay ahead of the game!

Last week's injury occurred when Miami Dolphins linebacker Chop Robinson grabbed Ford's ankle just before right tackle Jack Conklin fell on him. Following the injury, Ford limped off to the locker room and was later seen in the blue medical tent for further evaluation.

Ad

Ford did not practice during the week and will not play in the Browns' game against the Ravens, per the team's injury report.

The Browns subsequently placed Ford on the injured reserve list, along with tight end David Njoku (knee) and running back Pierre Strong Jr. (concussion), as reported by ESPN's Adam Schefter. Consequently, D'Onta Foreman and John Kelly will have to handle the team's backfield workload on Saturday afternoon.

Expand Tweet

Ad

How has Jerome Ford performed this season?

Following Nick Chubb's season-ending knee injury in Week 2 of last season, Jerome Ford took over as the Browns' starting running back. The former fifth-round pick finished the 2023 season with 813 rushing yardsand four rushing touchdowns, while also contributing 44 receptions and five receiving touchdowns.

Cleveland's 2024 season began with Ford as the starting running back for the first six games until Chubb returned to action against the Cincinnati Bengals in Week 7. However, in Week 15 against the Kansas City Chiefs, Chubb broke his foot, allowing Ford to return to the starting RB1 position.

Ad

Ford played in 14 games this season before being placed on IR on Friday. He led the Browns with 565 rushing yards and three rushing touchdowns. He also contributed 37 catches on 43 targets for 225 yards. The 25-year-old running back also averaged 25.9 yards on 59 kickoff returns.

Jerome Ford is expected to remain with the Browns through the 2025 season, but his role next year will depend on the team's offseason decisions to strengthen its running back department.

4.title: Is Jerry Jeudy playing today? Browns WR's status explored for Week 18 vs Ravens
4.snippet: Jerry Jeudy has been the talk of the town for the Cleveland Browns ahead of their Week 18 clash against the Baltimore Ravens.
4.content:
Jerry Jeudy has been the talk of the town for the Cleveland Browns ahead of their Week 18 clash against the Baltimore Ravens. The wideout has been one of the best offensive players for the Browns and fans want to know whether Jeudy will take the field for the team's regular-season finale on Saturday.

Ad

Is Browns WR Jerry Jeudy playing today vs. Ravens?

NFL: Cleveland Browns WR Jerry Jeudy - Source: Imagn

70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now

Barring any late injury or setback, Jerry Jeudy will play against the Ravens on Saturday. The wideout is active on the Browns roster and is expected to suit up for the Week 18 game.

Ad

Trending

Looking to predict NFL playoff Scenarios? Try our NFL Playoff Predictor for real-time simulations and stay ahead of the game!

Jeudy was on the injury report this past week, with a knee injury. However, he took part in full practice sessions on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday. Hence, all signs point toward Jeudy playing in Cleveland's regular-season finale.

The Browns signed Jeudy in the 2024 offseason. The receiver previously played four seasons with the Denver Broncos.

Jeudy earned the first Pro Bowl selection of his career this season. Although Cleveland will not make the playoffs, the wideout will aim to end the season on a high.

Ad

How has Browns WR Jerry Jeudy performed this season?

Jeudy has been one of the few bright sparks in the Browns' offense this season. The receiver has racked up 1,166 yards and four touchdowns on 84 receptions across 16 games. He had two games with 100+ receiving yards and one game with 200+ receiving yards.

The Browns are at the bottom of the AFC North and on a five-game losing streak. However, Jeudy and Co. will aim to end the season on a high when they take on the Ravens.

Ad

Here's a look at the TV schedule and live stream details for the Ravens-Browns Week 18 game, where you can catch Jeudy in action.

Time: 4:30 p.m. EST

TV channel: ABC/ESPN

5.title: Is Aaron Jones playing this week? Vikings RB's status revealed for Week 18 Lions showdown
5.snippet: The final game of the 2024 NFL regular season will pit the Detroit Lions against the Minnesota Vikings in a winner-take-all duel for the No.
5.content:
The final game of the 2024 NFL regular season will pit the Detroit Lions against the Minnesota Vikings in a winner-take-all duel for the No. 1 seed in the NFC.

Ad

The Lions and Vikings have been the two best teams in the conference, but only one will start their playoff campaign at home in the divisional round, while the other will be on the road during Wildcard Weekend.

The stakes are as high as they could be in a regular season game. Both teams are well-rounded but the Lions' defense has been struggling a bit due to the plethora of injuries to key players. Their run defense has been underwhelming over the past three games, as they have given up a shade over 110 yards on the ground in their last three games.

Ad

Trending

The Vikings will look to exploit that chink in Detroit's armor and fortunately for Minnesota, they'll have star running back Aaron Jones leading the effort.

Looking to predict NFL playoff Scenarios? Try our NFL Playoff Predictor for real-time simulations and stay ahead of the game!

Aaron Jones Injury Update: Will Vikings RB play in Week 18 vs. Lions?

The veteran suffered a quad injury in the Vikings' narrow 27-25 win over his former team, the Green Bay Packers, in Week 17. Jones was limited to 12 carries for 48 yards and there were concerns about whether he'd suit up for the regular-season finale against the Lions.

Ad

Expand Tweet

Ad

He was a limited participant in practice on Wednesday and Thursday but the shackles came off on Friday and the training staff declared him good to go. It's a massive relief for the Vikings, who need all hands on deck on Sunday night in Detroit.

Expand Tweet

Ad

Aaron Jones Stats: How has Vikings RB fared this season?

Aaron Jones joined the Vikings after an underwhelming season with the Packers in 2023. However, he bounced back in his debut season in Minnesota and has been critical to the team's success this season.

Through Week 17, he has 245 carries for 1,093 yards and five touchdowns. He needs only 27 yards against the Lions to set a new career-high for rushing yards in a season. He has also been spectacular in the passing game from the backfield. Jones has 46 catches for 378 yards and two receiving touchdowns. He needs 22 yards to breach the 400-yard mark for only the second time in his career.

Ad

The veteran's importance to the Vikings' offense cannot be overstated and the team will be relieved that his quad injury wasn't severe enough to force him to miss their highly-anticipated battle against the Lions.

Who do you think will win and take the No. 1 seed in the NFC when the Minnesota Vikings take on the Detroit Lions? Let us know your thoughts in the comments section below.

6.title: Is Justin Herbert playing this week? Exploring Chargers QB's status for Week 18
6.snippet: Quarterback Justin Herbert and the Los Angeles Chargers have guaranteed a playoff berth before their final game of the NFL regular season.
6.content:
Quarterback Justin Herbert and the Los Angeles Chargers have guaranteed a playoff berth before their final game of the NFL regular season. However, if the Pittsburgh Steelers lose to the Cincinnati Bengals this week, the Chargers might earn the fifth seed with a victory over the Las Vegas Raiders in Week 18.

Ad

The game between the Steelers and the Bengals is scheduled for Saturday night, before the Chargers' matchup with the Raiders on Sunday. Some fans are wondering if a Steelers win, which would guarantee the Chargers the No. 6 seed, would mean Justin Herbert will sit out the game on Sunday since a win won't really matter.

Expand Tweet

Ad

Trending

70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now

Exploring Justin Herbert's status for Week 18

This week, head coach Jim Harbaugh has given plenty of hints that the Los Angeles Chargers will play their key players against the Las Vegas Raiders on Sunday in an attempt to move up in the playoff seeding.

Looking to predict NFL playoff Scenarios? Try our NFL Playoff Predictor for real-time simulations and stay ahead of the game!

If that's the case, quarterback Justin Herbert will suit up in Week 18 as he's currently not dealing with injuries ahead of gameday.

Ad

"11 wins sounds better than 10. We're playing to move up. I mean, we'd love to be in the fifth seed," Harbaugh said when asked if he'd sit his starters for the game against Las Vegas. "That gives you a chance to have a playoff game at home. It could even be in the divisional round at home and the championship game at home, so that's where things stand for us."

Ad

Herbert has struggled with a number of injuries this season, including one leg injury and two ankle injuries. He has been able to play despite his ailments, though, and has not missed a game yet.

How has Justin Herbert performed this season?

The signal-caller has been good this season, especially in the latter stages of the season, despite battling some persistent injuries, such as a plantar fascia foot problem that kept him out of action during training camp.

Ad

Expand Tweet

Ad

He has completed 65% of his passes in the Chargers offense this season. He has amassed 3,524 passing yards and 21 touchdowns against only three interceptions. In addition, he has averaged 16.5 yards rushing per game, adding 264 yards on 65 carries and two touchdowns on the ground.

He eclipsed Peyton Manning's mark for the most passing yards in an NFL player's first five seasons, which had stood for 20 years, during last week's game against the New England Patriots.

7.title: Is Drake Maye playing this week? Exploring Patriots QB's status for Week 18
7.snippet: The New England Patriots are heading into their season finale against the Buffalo Bills at Gillette Stadium with the joint-worst record in the NFL.
7.content:
The New England Patriots are heading into their season finale against the Buffalo Bills at Gillette Stadium with the joint-worst record in the NFL. They are tied with the Tennessee Titans, Cleveland Browns, and New York Giants at 3-13.

Ad

The Patriots will pick first on April 24th if they lose on Sunday. However, they could slip to fourth with a win over the Bills, who will be fielding their backup players having already secured the second seed in the AFC standings.

The team's offensive coordinator Alex Van Pelt clarified that the team wasn't worried about its place in the draft order and plans to play to win. During his media availability last Thursday, he said:

Ad

Trending

70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now

"We're playing the game to win the game, for sure. We'll see how it goes from that point. But yes, that's the intent."

Looking to predict NFL playoff Scenarios? Try our NFL Playoff Predictor for real-time simulations and stay ahead of the game!

However, they might fall short in their bid to beat Buffalo if quarterback Drake Maye misses the game.

Drake Maye injury update: Will QB play in Week 18 vs. the Bills?

The rookie is nursing a hand injury and has been a limited participant in practice throughout the week. His status for the game on Sunday against the Bills has been listed as questionable on the team's injury report.

Ad

Expand Tweet

Ad

While the Patriots are being coy about Drake Maye's availability, head coach Jerod Mayo suggested on Wednesday that he'll suit up and play barring any setbacks in practice:

"Drake's healthy. He'll be at practice today, and we'll see how it goes this week... He's a competitor. He wants to play. He's still developing, so he'll be ready to go."

There have been no reports about the rookie's injury worsening. He'll likely play against the Bills on Sunday.

Ad

Drake Maye stats: How has the QB fared this season?

Drake Maye started the year as the Patriots' backup quarterback behind veteran Jacoby Brissett. However, the coaching staff handed the reins of the offense to the rookie in Week 6 and he hasn't looked back since.

He has thrown for 2,254 yards, 15 touchdowns, and 10 interceptions in 11 games. He also has 421 rushing yards despite the Patriots not having any designed quarterback runs in their playbook.

It remains to be seen whether he plays in Week 18 against the Bills. If he doesn't, the Patriots would still deem his rookie season a massive success.

9.title: “I want to be here”: Justin Fields makes feelings clear on Steelers' return as $3,233,448 season comes close to end
9.snippet: Justin Fields started the 2024 campaign on a run set to make Russell Wilson old news. However, once Wilson took the helm in the middle of the season,...
9.content:
Justin Fields started the 2024 campaign on a run set to make Russell Wilson old news. However, once Wilson took the helm in the middle of the season, Fields was mostly relegated out of the spotlight.

Ad

With things seemingly unclear for the team and the quarterback moving forward, many have speculated what is to come after his 2024 $3,233,448 cap hit drops off the books.

In a statement made to Triblive, Fields at least opened up on his feelings about what he wants to do after the season:

70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now

“I want to be here. I’m kind of tired of learning a new offense every year. This will be my third in four years. Of course, I’d love to be back, but that’s all up to God at the end of the day. I’ll be where God wants me to be.”

Ad

Trending

Looking to predict NFL playoff Scenarios? Try our NFL Playoff Predictor for real-time simulations and stay ahead of the game!

Of course, one might hope that he was more enthusiastic about remaining with the team and having another reason for staying beyond not wanting to learn a new playbook. However, the Steelers now know Fields' position and can act accordingly depending on what they wish to do.

Justin Fields' contract situation puts Steelers on course for QB house-cleaning

Justin Fields at Pittsburgh Steelers v Cincinnati Bengals - Source: Getty

The Steelers quarterback is still working on his rookie contract, but not for long. The quarterback is working under the same contract he signed with the Chicago Bears and as the team never picked up his fifth-year option, his contract will effectively expire in just days.

Ad

Meanwhile, Russell Wilson was brought aboard on a one-year deal that will also conclude at the same time as Justin Fields'. Depending on how the Steelers play it, they can end up losing both quarterbacks, landing in a similar spot they were in 2024.

Of course, with three quarterbacks on the depth chart, some may think the team at least has Kyle Allen in their back pocket. However, per Spotrac, Allen's deal is also set to expire after the season.

Put simply, the Steelers have a mountain of work ahead of them to figure out who will be in the room next season. Could the quarterback plan look entirely different for a third straight season?

0.title: Better Buy for 2025: ExxonMobil or Chevron?
0.snippet: On this front, Chevron wins hands down with a 4.5% yield. Exxon's yield is a lower 3.7%. That may not seem like a huge difference on an absolute basis, but...
0.content:
Natural gas prices recently jumped 20% in a single day. That's a pretty shocking move but, frankly, not all that unusual when it comes to energy prices. If you are looking at the broader energy sector and trying to figure out which stock to buy as 2025 gets underway, your best option is probably going to be an integrated energy giant like ExxonMobil (XOM -1.03%) or Chevron (CVX 0.23%).

Here's how these two U.S. energy giants stack up and why you might want to pick Chevron.

The benefits of integration

As the natural gas example above highlights, energy prices are highly volatile. That often leads to massive swings in the prices of energy producers. Energy producers live in the upstream segment of the broader energy sector.

There are, however, two other segments, the midstream and downstream. Midstream companies own things like pipelines and collect fees from companies that use these assets to transport energy commodities. It is a relatively stable segment of the broader energy sector.

Meanwhile, downstream companies use oil and natural gas to produce chemicals and other refined products. Downstream companies often benefit from lower energy prices, though it is important to note that chemicals and refined products are often commodity products themselves subject to their own, sometimes volatile, price dynamics.

Integrated energy companies like Exxon and Chevron have exposure to all three segments of the broader energy industry. Although oil and natural gas prices are still the driving force behind financial results, having exposure to the midstream and downstream helps to soften the peaks and valleys.

For most investors, going with an integrated energy company will be the best choice. And sticking to the industry giants, a list that includes Exxon, Chevron, BP, Shell, and TotalEnergies, will probably be the best individual option. In this regard, Exxon and Chevron are interchangeable with any of the others on the list.

Dividends that keep going up

That said, Exxon and Chevron stand out in a very important way. They have both increased their dividends annually for decades. BP and Shell cut their dividends during the early days of the pandemic in 2020. TotalEnergies didn't cut its dividend at that point, but it just doesn't have the same track record of regular dividend growth that Exxon and Chevron have. Exxon and Chevron have shown a material dedication to investors and that quickly winnows down the choice from five to two.

But Exxon's streak of annual dividend increases is better. The energy giant has hiked its dividend for 42 consecutive years. Chevron's streak is "just" 37 years long. Clearly, this is something of a fine distinction, since both are very impressive dividend streaks. However, Exxon still gets the edge, even if it is only a slight advantage.

A higher yield with Chevron

The other side of the dividend, however, is the dividend yield. On this front, Chevron wins hands down with a 4.5% yield. Exxon's yield is a lower 3.7%. That may not seem like a huge difference on an absolute basis, but percentage wise Chevron's yield is 20% higher. That's a very big difference that will likely be of interest to income-focused investors.

That outcome, however, has to be juxtaposed against the risk of a dividend cut. Because energy prices, and thus earnings, are so volatile, the dividend payout ratio isn't a great indication of dividend sustainability in the energy sector. You have to focus on a mix of the company's commitment to the dividend (which is good for both Chevron and Exxon) and financial strength. In this case, Chevron and Exxon have similarly low debt-to-equity ratios, suggesting that their leverage is modest.

In fact, this is part of the long-term plan, as both add debt during industry downturns so they can continue to fund their businesses and dividends. When energy prices recover, as they always have historically, the companies pay down the debt they took on. Although you wouldn't be taking on massive risk with Exxon, the added yield from Chevron still wins out here from a risk/reward basis.

Temporary headwinds at Chevron

The next question to ask when comparing Chevron and Exxon is why there is a dividend yield discrepancy. The answer is pretty simple -- Exxon is performing better right now on some key industry metrics, including return on capital employed. Chevron is also in the middle of buying Hess, but the deal is being held up because of business relationships Hess has with other companies, including Exxon. Investors are clearly worried that Chevron just isn't hitting on all cylinders right now.

That is a legitimate concern and, perhaps, it is appropriate that Chevron's yield is higher. However, if you think in decades and not days this could also be an opportunity. Given Chevron's long and successful history, financial strength, and diversified business model, it seems highly likely that it will eventually muddle through this patch of weakness. And even if the Hess deal falls apart, the $250 billion market cap company is large enough and financially strong enough to simply find another acquisition candidate if it wants to.

All in, Chevron is trailing behind Exxon today. But investors are getting paid for the added risk this poses via the higher dividend yield. That will probably be an attractive risk/reward trade-off for most investors.

It could go either way with Exxon and Chevron

You wouldn't be making a massive mistake if you bought Exxon over Chevron in 2025. But, at the same time, Chevron appears to offer some compelling advantages over Exxon, particularly if you are focused on maximizing the income your portfolio generates. With similar business models, similar financial strength profiles, and similar commitments to shareholder returns (highlighted by their strong dividend track records), choosing higher-yielding Chevron seems like the right call for 2025.

3.title: Chevron Houston Marathon tightens security after New Orleans attack
3.snippet: The Chevron Houston Marathon is ramping up security measures ahead of its annual event, set to take place in just over two weeks.
3.content:
Following the tragic New Year’s Day attack in New Orleans, the Chevron Houston Marathon is ramping up security measures ahead of its annual event, set to take place in just over two weeks.

With safety as a top priority, officials are collaborating with law enforcement and emergency services to ensure the protection of participants, spectators, and staff.

In a statement, the Houston Marathon Committee expressed its commitment to public safety:

“The safety and wellbeing of our participants, stakeholders, and community is our top priority. We work closely in collaboration with local authorities, law enforcement, and emergency services year-round to plan. We truly appreciate the annual support from all city agencies and are grateful that the Director of the Mayor’s Office of Public Safety and Homeland Security, Larry Satterwhite, has provided this statement for us to share,” said Wade Morehead, Executive Director of the Houston Marathon Committee.

BACKGROUND: Former HPD captain predicts enhance security for Houston Chevron Marathon following New Orleans attack

Larry Satterwhite, Director of the Mayor’s Office of Public Safety and Homeland Security also provided a detailed statement:

“Like the rest of the nation, our hearts are broken by the senseless tragedy in New Orleans. The City of Houston and all public safety agencies are actively collaborating to ensure the safety and security of our community and future public events such as the Chevron Houston Marathon. In order to keep our public events safe and visitors and participants out of harm’s way, we rely heavily on the trusted relationships we’ve built with our first responder partners. Collaboration is the cornerstone of our success.

“For every event, we assess all potential threats and take proactive steps to mitigate them. By looking across the nation, we continuously seek opportunities to learn and improve, strengthening our ability to protect the Houston public. To ensure maximum coverage, we deploy uniformed personnel and specialized equipment that will be visible throughout the event, ready to assist and protect in every way possible. At the same time, we strategically position plainclothes personnel to enhance our readiness and response, if an unexpected attack or incident occurs.

“However, our greatest partner in public safety is the public itself. We urge everyone to remain vigilant and if you see anything suspicious, please don’t hesitate to say something. Together, we can make a difference because public safety is a shared responsibility. We are committed to working hand-in-hand with all public safety agencies to create a safe environment at each public event and for everyone attending.”

7.title: GlobalData: Oil and gas industry sees non-US hiring gaining momentum amid overall decline in jobs
7.snippet: The oil and gas industry has seen a dip in active jobs (jobs open for hiring) in 2024, but hiring trends remain relatively better compared to pre-COVID-19...
7.content:
The oil and gas industry has seen a dip in active jobs (jobs open for hiring) in 2024, but hiring trends remain relatively better compared to pre-COVID-19 levels. In 2024, countries with high job postings in the industry included the US, India, and the UK, while countries with high year-on-year (YoY) growth in job postings included Sweden and United Arab Emirates (UAE). However, there has been a noticeable increase in job opportunities from non-US companies in locations outside of the US, according to GlobalData, a leading data and analytics company.

Sherla Sriprada, Business Fundamentals Analyst at GlobalData, comments: “It is noteworthy that even though the US continues to account for a majority of jobs posted by several key players, other countries across different continents are also seeing hiring activity by these companies. Interestingly, US-headquartered companies are also seen posting good number of jobs in other nations. The US accounts for a significant number of jobs but companies also seem to be looking to tap opportunities beyond the US as well.”

Exxon and Chevron, two major players in the oil and gas industry, also saw a decline in job postings. Most of the job postings by these two companies were for the US. Meanwhile, they also posted a significant number of jobs for the Philippines, Argentina, and India locations. In 2024, Exxon posted 144 jobs in Bengaluru, India, and Chevron posted 58 jobs, where they have both set up offices.

Exxon is focusing on EM lithium products in the US and lubes operations in Argentina, whereas Chevron is looking at supply and trading bulk operations in Argentina and complying with GHG/methane regulations in the US.

ExxonMobil’s LNG affiliate in India supports the upstream business and provides consultant services for other ExxonMobil upstream affiliates and conducts LNG market-development activities. In November 2024, the company posted “Senior Production Engineer (Oil and Gas)” role for supporting ExxonMobil’s global portfolio of deepwater, conventional, unconventional, and heavy oil assets. The role also looks at applying technologies for oilfield production optimisation using data-driven or physics-based methods.

The “Instrument and Electrical Reliability Engineering (I&E RE)” position in Chevron’s ENGINE Centre (located in Bengaluru, India) provides instrumentation and electrical asset support to Chevron’s operational refineries and LNG facilities.

Sriprada adds: “Employment trend analysis at Exxon and Chevron from GlobalData’s Company Filings Analytics Database also reveals that Exxon’s worldwide employee counts have declined over the last five years, while Chevron has seen an increase in 2023. However, Exxon US employee counts have seen a marginal increase in 2023 while Chevron US employee counts had a much healthier growth.”

World Pipelines’ December 2024 issue

The December 2024 issue of World Pipelines includes an in-depth Argentinian pipeline outlook; inline inspection case studies; and technical articles on hydrogen pipeline transport, metering and monitoring, and underwater inspection.

8.title: Are large events safe to attend? From Mardi Gras to the Marathon, security changes could be coming in Galveston
8.snippet: Galveston is working to make safety improvements ahead of Mardi Gras, and the Chevron Houston Marathon issued a safety statement following the terrorist attack...
8.content:
From Mardi Gras to the Marathon, security changes could be coming

Galveston is working to make safety improvements ahead of Mardi Gras, and the Chevron Houston Marathon issued a safety statement following the terrorist attack in New Orleans.

Galveston is working to make safety improvements ahead of Mardi Gras, and the Chevron Houston Marathon issued a safety statement following the terrorist attack in New Orleans.

Galveston is working to make safety improvements ahead of Mardi Gras, and the Chevron Houston Marathon issued a safety statement following the terrorist attack in New Orleans.

Galveston is working to make safety improvements ahead of Mardi Gras, and the Chevron Houston Marathon issued a safety statement following the terrorist attack in New Orleans.

GALVESTON, Texas (KTRK) -- Galveston is working to make safety improvements ahead of Mardi Gras, and the Chevron Houston Marathon issued a safety statement following the terrorist attack in New Orleans.

Some people can't wait for the floats, beads, and food next month in Galveston.

"I'm ready," Del Sol and Cariloha assignment manager Lucio Nieto said. "Fat Tuesday, you better watch out. This year's a little different, but I'm going to eat what I can and enjoy it."

Nieto is excited and knows some may be anxious after what happened in New Orleans.

"There is too much opportunity to be missed by people who are going to do anything to hinder that," Nieto said. "I think we're going to be more than okay this year is my hope and belief."

Galveston leaders are working to make sure that happens. Island officials say 350,000 attend the Mardi Gras festivities.

RELATED: Experts discuss possible changes coming to Houston-area events after New Orleans terrorist attack

To protect them, officials say they're making improvements following the terrorist attack in New Orleans. Law enforcement said a man drove a truck around barricades on Bourbon Street and killed more than ten and injured dozens more.

The island uses barriers like these during Mardi Gras, but it is unsure if it is enough and is looking to make improvements.

"I mean, it's a start, but I feel like we have a long way to go to make it more safe for everyone," Alvin resident Sylvia Ovregon said.

While Galveston said it's looking to make safety improvements for future events, in Houston, it's a different story. HPD told ABC13 it doesn't share tactical information.

In about two weeks, around 300,000 runners, volunteers, and spectators will take part in the Chevron Houston Marathon. Officials told ABC13 they watch for what happens across the country and look for ways to improve safety. However, they didn't tell us if any changes will be made because of what happened in New Orleans.

"If they're doing something, then I'm glad," Galveston resident Jennifer Johnson said. "Now, regarding whether what they're going to do is going to really help, it's one of those things that you won't know until you try it."

Mardi Gras attendees are happy to hear safety measures are being discussed.

"I feel safe every single day," Nieto said. "Rather than allow the fear to deter you from coming, please come."

With hundreds of thousands expected to enjoy the floats, beads, and food, island officials say they're working to ensure their protection.

ABC13 contacted the Chevron Houston Marathon about its security plan after the attack.

Houston Marathon Committee Statement:

"The safety and well-being of our participants, stakeholders, and community is our top priority. We work closely in collaboration with local authorities, law enforcement, and emergency services year-round to plan. We truly appreciate the annual support from all city agencies and are grateful that the Director of the Mayor's Office of Public Safety and Homeland Security, Larry Satterwhite, has provided this statement for us to share," said Wade Morehead, Executive Director of the Houston Marathon Committee."

Mayor's Office of Public Safety and Homeland Security Statement:

"Like the rest of the nation, our hearts are broken by the senseless tragedy in New Orleans. The City of Houston and all public safety agencies are actively collaborating to ensure the safety and security of our community and future public events such as the Chevron Houston Marathon. In order to keep our public events safe and visitors and participants out of harm's way, we rely heavily on the trusted relationships we've built with our first responder partners. Collaboration is the cornerstone of our success. For every event, we assess all potential threats and take proactive steps to mitigate them. By looking across the nation, we continuously seek opportunities to learn and improve, strengthening our ability to protect the Houston public. To ensure maximum coverage, we deploy uniformed personnel and specialized equipment that will be visible throughout the event, ready to assist and protect in every way possible. At the same time, we strategically position plainclothes personnel to enhance our readiness and response, if an unexpected attack or incident occurs. However, our greatest partner in public safety is the public itself. We urge everyone to remain vigilant and if you see anything suspicious, please don't hesitate to say something. Together, we can make a difference because public safety is a shared responsibility. We are committed to working hand-in-hand with all public safety agencies to create a safe environment at each public event and for everyone attending."

For updates on this story, follow Nick Natario on Facebook, X and Instagram.

0.title: Former HPD captain predicts enhanced security for Houston Chevron Marathon following New Orleans attack
0.snippet: With the Chevron Houston Marathon just 16 days away, safety concerns have escalated following the terror attack in New Orleans on New Year's Day.
0.content:
With the Chevron Houston Marathon just 16 days away, safety concerns have escalated following the terror attack in New Orleans on New Year’s Day.

Retired HPD Captain Greg Fremin said while Houston has been fortunate in avoiding attacks during large public gatherings, the risk of a lone wolf or coordinated attack remains a significant concern.

“We have to be right 100% of the time, and we hope they don’t get it right one time,” Fremin said, underscoring the importance of vigilance. “That’s our fear that you’re going to have other open areas that are in here. Can somebody infiltrate the race route? Would it be possible for someone to do that? Absolutely. But we have contingency plans in place for that.”

As in previous years, the Chevron Houston Marathon will draw a crowd of around 300,000 people to the area surrounding Discovery Green and along the race route.

In light of recent events, Fremin believes that law enforcement agencies are considering additional safety measures, such as the creation of “no-drive zones” around key areas like Discovery Green to prevent vehicles from getting too close to the crowds.

“You’re going to have a footprint,” Fremin said. “But it could be expanded, and you might see some more additional road closures coming into this area downtown. So, I would definitely look for something like that happening, and that’s going to basically secure this area from vehicle traffic. It’ll be open for pedestrians, but it’ll be shut down for vehicles.”

Despite these preparations, Fremin acknowledged that ensuring total security for such an open event is challenging. However, he stressed that authorities are committed to minimizing risks and responding to any threats promptly.

The Chevron Houston Marathon did not comment on this story.

KPRC 2 did reach out to the Mayor’s Office and HPD for comment but were unable to reschedule an interview or get a statement, but further details are expected as the marathon draws nearer.

1.title: Chevron signs 20-year LNG deal with Energy Transfer
1.snippet: Energy Transfer announced a 20-year agreement to supply Chevron with two million tons per annum (mtpa) of liquefied natural gas (LNG) from its Lake Charles LNG...
1.content:
On Dec. 19, Energy Transfer announced a 20-year agreement to supply Chevron with two million tons per annum (mtpa) of liquefied natural gas (LNG) from its Lake Charles LNG export facility in Louisiana.

Under the terms of the agreement, Energy Transfer LNG will provide LNG to Chevron on a free-on-board basis. The pricing structure includes a fixed liquefaction fee and a variable component tied to the Henry Hub natural gas benchmark, Energy Transfer said. The statement also noted obligations of Energy Transfer LNG under the sale and purchase agreement are subject to Energy Transfer LNG taking a final investment decision (FID) as well as the satisfaction of other conditions precedent.

Energy Transfer noted the company's Lake Charles LNG facility is designed to leverage existing infrastructure, including four LNG storage tanks, two deepwater berths, and other assets from its current "regasification" operations. The company said the facility’s integration with its trunkline pipeline system provides direct access to major natural gas producing regions such as the Haynesville, Permian, and Marcellus Shale basins.

2.title: Old Dominion Drop Sun Belt Conference Game vs Arkansas State, 78-59
2.snippet: Arkansas State lived up to its preseason billing by downing the Monarchs, 78-59, in ODU's first Sun Belt home game of the season at Chartway Arena.
2.content:
NORFOLK, Va. – Old Dominion had to shoot well and tap the brakes on Arkansas State’s fast break in order to upset the Red Wolves Thursday night, and alas for ODU, the Monarchs did neither.

The Sun Belt Conference preseason favorite, Arkansas State lived up to its preseason billing by downing the Monarchs, 78-59, in ODU’s first Sun Belt home game of the season at Chartway Arena.

The loss snapped a two-game winning streak for ODU (5-9 overall, 1-1 Sun Belt). Arkansas State (11-3, 2-0), which won by 13 points earlier this season at then No. 15 Memphis, has won its last six.

The game began with promise for ODU. The Monarchs erased an early 14-point deficit and trailed by just three, 32-29, at the half.

The momentum continued into the early minutes of the second half, as Caelum Swanton-Rodger made a layup, then blocked two shots on the next Arkansas State possession.

Robert Davis Jr. was fouled on a three-point shot and made three free throws to tie the score at 34-all three minutes into the half.

But things thing fell apart for ODU. Arkansas State went on a 20-6 run, capped by a three-point shot by Terrance Ford Jr., that gave the Red Wolves a 54-40 lead with 11:12 left.

The Monarchs failed to get the lead into single digits the rest of the way.

Sean Durugordon, the 6-foot-6 transfer from Siena, led the Monarchs with 21 points and hauled down eight rebounds. Jaden Johnson continued what has been a sterling freshman season so far by scoring a career-high 18 points.

Arkansas State’s defense concentrated on shutting down Davis, who scored 32 points in ODU’s five-point Sun Belt victory at Louisiana-Monroe nearly two weeks ago, and the Red Wolves succeeded, holding him to six.

The Monarchs made just 27 percent of all shots (17/64) and 17% on three-pointers (4/24).

Arkansas State may be the Sun Belt's deepest team and that depth showed as the Red Wolves' bench outscored ODU, 40-8.

First-year ODU Head Coach Mike Jones said his team lacked discipline, especially in the second half, on both sides of the floor.

"They already heard it from me tonight and they're going to hear it from me again, we have to be more disciplined," he said.

"We picked the wrong night against the wrong team to not shoot the ball well. We played poorly in all facets of the game. We didn't get to the rim. We didn't get to the free throw line."

"That's not who we are," he added. "We're a better team than that."

Arkansas State early-on appeared to be feeling the effect of a long layoff as the Red Wolves’ last game came 12 days earlier, a 97-67 victory over Coastal Carolina on Jan. 21.

The Red Wolves missed their first eight shots and didn’t draw any net until almost seven minutes into the game.

"We missed an opportunity there," Jones said. "We should have had 15 points."

"If they looked up and saw they were in a little deeper of a hole, that changes the game. That changes the way they look at things."

Terrance Ford Jr. broke the ice for the Red Wolves on a layup with 13:15 in the half which began a 19-2 Arkansas State run capped by Rashaud Marshall’s layup five minutes later that gave the Red Wolves a 19-8 lead.

It was 24-10 with six minutes left when ODU retook momentum from Arkansas State by closing out the half with a 19-8 run.

The Monarchs next play this Saturday at 4 p.m. when they host Southern Miss at Chartway Arena.

It will be a quick turnaround for Johnson, who played 36 minutes, and Davis, who played 37.

"Everyone has to get their rest and then lock in on Southern Miss so that we can get the win," Johnson said.

"We have to turn the page and quickly," Jones added. "If you didn't make your free throws tonight, I expect to see you in the gym tomorrow morning shooting free throws.

"We need to put this one behind us."

3.title: Supreme Court ruling hailed by red states could end up helping blue states resist Trump policies
3.snippet: Overturning of the 'Chevron doctrine' may affect everything from fishing rules to transgender rights under Trump. By: Tim Henderson - January 2, 2025 3:37...

4.title: Net neutrality eviscerated by appeals court ruling
4.snippet: The Sixth Circuit Court of Appeals struck down the Federal Communications Commission's net neutrality rules, thanks in part to the downfall of Chevron...
4.content:
The three-judge panel ruled that the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) does not have the authority to impose net neutrality rules on internet service providers (ISPs). The FCC sought to reclassify ISPs as common carriers under Title II of the Communications Act in order to impose policies meant to prevent them from discriminating against different internet traffic, like by slowing speeds or blocking content.

But the judges disagreed with the agency’s interpretation of how ISPs could be classified and were emboldened by the recent downfall of Chevron deference, a legal doctrine that instructed courts to defer to regulatory agencies in many cases. After the Supreme Court did away with that principle in 2024, courts became more free to favor their own interpretations over the judgment of expert agencies. Net neutrality was immediately seen as a prime target to be struck down without Chevron. While the DC Circuit Court of Appeals upheld previous iterations of net neutrality, the Sixth Circuit judges note that it relied on Chevron to do so. “Unlike past challenges that the D.C. Circuit considered under Chevron, we no longer afford deference to the FCC’s reading of the statute,” they write.

“We acknowledge that the workings of the Internet are complicated and dynamic, and that the FCC has significant expertise in overseeing ‘this technical and complex area,’” the ruling says, citing an earlier decision. After the fall of Chevron, it continues, “that ‘capability,’ if you will, cannot be used to overwrite the plain meaning of the statute.”

This left the judges free to wax philosophical about phrases like “offering of a capability” and “information services,” finely parsing the distinction between those and more heavily regulated telecommunications services. “The existence of a fact or a thought in one’s mind is not ‘information’ like 0s and 1s used by computers,” one part of the ruling reads. It asserts that “speaking reduces a thought to sound, and writing reduces a thought to text ... during a phone call, one creates audio information by speaking, which the telephone service transmits to an interlocutor, who responds in turn,” but “crucially, the telephone service merely transmits that which a speaker creates; it does not access information.”

Net neutrality was already in danger, even before this ruling came out — in a suit filed against the FCC by broadband industry associations. The appeals court had already blocked the net neutrality rules from taking effect. During oral arguments in October, the three Republican-appointed judges prodded attorneys about the correct interpretation of the Communications Act and about deference to agency expertise. With President-elect Donald Trump — under whom net neutrality was previously repealed — due to take office in mere weeks, this could be the last we hear about the attempt to reclassify broadband providers as common carriers for a while.

FCC Chair Jessica Rosenworcel called on lawmakers to take up the mantle of creating rules to safeguard the open internet. “Consumers across the country have told us again and again that they want an internet that is fast, open, and fair,” she says in a statement. “With this decision it is clear that Congress now needs to heed their call, take up the charge for net neutrality, and put open internet principles in federal law.”

Republican Commissioner Brendan Carr, Trump’s pick to lead the agency once he assumes office, issued a lengthy statement calling the ruling “a good win for the country.” He calls net neutrality rules an attempt by the Biden administration to “expand the government’s control over every feature of the Internet ecosystem” and says the push for the rules was a waste of time. While he’s pleased with the ruling, he adds, “The work to unwind the Biden Administration’s regulatory overreach will continue.”
