6.title: N-Hexane Market Global Market Report, with Profiles of Key Market Players ExxonMobil, Shell, Indian Oil, Chevron, Bharat Petroleum, DHC Solvent Chemie, Sak Chaisidhi and Liaoning Yufeng Chemical Co.
6.snippet: Dublin, Dec. 30, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The.
6.content:
Dublin, Dec. 30, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The "N-Hexane Market Report Global Forecast By Application, Countries and Company Analysis" report has been added to ResearchAndMarkets.com's offering.



The global n-Hexane market is projected to surge from US$2.45 billion in 2024 to US$3.46 billion by 2033 at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 3.91% from 2025 to 2033.

The rise in demand for pharmaceuticals, adhesives, and chemical extraction is the key driver for the n-hexane market growth. N-hexane is primarily used as a solvent, particularly in extracting edible oils, thereby adding up to its market growth. With growing industrial applications, further growth will be shown in the market in the forecast period.







Key Factors Driving the n-Hexane Market Growth

Growing Demand in the Edible Oil Extraction Industry



n-Hexane's ability to effectively extract oil from seeds and vegetables makes it a vital component in the edible oil industry. As global consumption of cooking oils, particularly soybean and sunflower, rises, the demand for n-Hexane follows suit. Its efficiency in separating oils from organic matter has made it indispensable in large-scale food processing industries worldwide. With increasing population and urbanization, emerging markets also contribute to this growth as they seek cost-effective solutions for oil extraction to meet growing consumer demands for edible oils.



Expanding Use in Pharmaceuticals and Chemical Industry



Applications of n-Hexane in drug formulation and solvent manufacturing in the pharmaceutical and chemical industries play a very important role in the market. The fact that it is non-polar means it acts effectively for the solubilization of compounds otherwise hard to handle. This diversity, combined with increased pharmaceutical production around the world, has fueled demand. More importantly, n-Hexane is applied in a number of chemical extraction processes that are important to industry applications and continue to drive growth in the market as those industries expand and evolve.



Rising Demand in Adhesives, Inks, and Rubber Manufacturing



With solvent properties, n-Hexane is used extensively in the manufacture of adhesives, printing inks, and rubber. Such an application gives way to effective bonding and processing of materials. Increasing global industrialization and construction call for demand for such products. Additionally, the growing automobile industries provide for a higher demand on rubber and adhesives, which are produced using n-Hexane. Therefore, industrial growth would further augment steady market growth in the coming years.



United States n-Hexane Market



The n-Hexane market in the United States remains strong since it is broadly applied in all sectors involved in oil extraction, pharmaceuticals, and adhesives. Its demand is also significantly contributed by the strong agricultural sector of the country, particularly soybean and corn oil extraction. There is also the growing pharmaceutical industry that uses it as a solvent in drug production. Industrial applications such as rubber and adhesive manufacturing increase its market even more.

However, long-term growth in the market may be impacted by increasing regulatory scrutiny amid concerns for the environment and health. The United States Department of Agriculture forecasts that global production of vegetable oil would be 222.85 million metric tons between 2023 and 2024. Of the palm oil total, an estimated 90% is consumed as food, while the remaining 10% is for industrial purposes: cosmetics, fuel, and diesel. The soybean oil was primarily consumed, followed by 61.68 million tons in 2022 globally. Considering all these facts mentioned above, edible oil extraction application is most likely to lead the n-hexane market for the forecast period. The n-Hexane industry of Germany is gaining at a moderate growth rate primarily owing to the production of oil extraction, pharmaceutical industries, and various other industrial applications.



Germany n-Hexane Industry



Germany is the hub of Europe's industrial centers and has a high requirement for n-Hexane to provide various manufacturing industries that are adhesives, rubber, and chemical manufacturing. Pharmaceutical manufacturers also require n-Hexane as a solvent in drug formulation. Again, strict environmental compliances regarding VOCs within the European Union might later affect the industry in terms of having safer and more eco-friendly alternatives. The n-Hexane industry grows well in Indonesia mainly since it has been consuming quite large portions in the extraction process of vegetable oils, mainly for palm oil which is one of the leading sectors in the country.



Indonesia n-Hexane Industry



Indonesia, being one of the world's leading producers of palm oil, has consequently high demand for n-Hexane since there are highly efficient processes that use such solvents in extractions of oils. n-Hexane also finds uses in manufacturing adhesives and rubber industries in addition to chemical industries, hence catalyzing the growth in the development of the country's industrial sectors. According to estimates made by the US Department of Agriculture, total oil produced by Indonesia in the year 2023-2024 was around 53.32 million metric tons.



Global n-Hexane Company Analysis



The key players in n-hexane industry are ExxonMobil, Shell, Indian Oil Corporation, Chevron, Bharat Petroleum Corporation, DHC Solvent Chemie, Sak Chaisidhi Company and Liaoning Yufeng Chemical Co.



Global n-Hexane Company News

May 2024: A joint venture between Chandra Asri Capital Pte. Ltd. and Glencore Asian Holdings Pte. Ltd., CAPGC Pte. Ltd., will purchase Singapore's Energy and Chemicals Park from Royal Dutch Shell PLC. Through the deal, CAPGC will acquire Shell's entire stake in Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Singapore.

May 2024: The Exxon Mobil Corporation said that the Pioneer Natural Resources Company transaction had been completed. With the largest, highest-return development potential in the Permian Basin, an unconventional business will be created by the merging of ExxonMobil and Pioneer.

May 2024: A framework agreement for strategic partnership was signed in Paris by Patrick Pouyanne, the CEO and chairman of TotalEnergies, and Ma Yongsheng, the chairman of Sinopec. The agreement states that the two parties would look for more opportunities for collaboration in a range of industries, such as the development of oil and gas, the LNG value chain, chemicals and refining, engineering and trading, new energy, and so forth.

7.title: Cowboys' Stephen Jones makes feelings clear on Trey Lance ahead of Commanders game
7.snippet: Cowboys Executive Vice President Stephen Jones offered a noncommittal response about backup quarterback Trey Lance's potentially starting in Week 18.
7.content:
Cowboys Executive Vice President Stephen Jones offered a noncommittal response about backup quarterback Trey Lance's potentially starting in Week 18. His measured words hint at the organization's hesitancy to give Lance extended playing opportunities, mirroring a pattern throughout the 2024 season.

Ad

Jones, who oversees the Cowboys' player personnel decisions, commented on Trey Lance's situation following a 41-7 loss to Philadelphia on Sunday. The game marked Lance's first regular-season appearance for Dallas, and he completed a single pass for 1 yard in garbage time.

Speaking to 105.3 The FAN on Sunday, Jones addressed mounting questions about Lance's role in the upcoming season finale on Sunday. The timing proved significant, as fans and media voices had criticized the team's handling of Lance during the Eagles game;

Ad

Trending

70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now

"We want to finish strong against Washington," Jones said. "We'll look at that situation this week and see where we go from there."

Looking to predict NFL playoff Scenarios? Try our NFL Playoff Predictor for real-time simulations and stay ahead of the game!

Expand Tweet

Ad

The comment followed Trey Lance's appearance in Philadelphia, where he entered with just 2:22 remaining. ESPN insider Ed Werder highlighted the organizational stance during the game, noting Lance "seems to have no support from the coaching staff or front office."

Trey Lance's limited opportunities raise questions

NFL: Philadelphia Eagles at Dallas Cowboys - Source: Imagn

Dallas coach Mike McCarthy's postgame revelations sparked debate. He acknowledged considering Trey Lance "the series before" but waited until the final minutes.

Ad

When pressed about Week 18's starter, McCarthy responded:

"I don't know. I'm not there yet."

Lance's preseason performance offers context to the Cowboys' reluctance. He struggled with consistency, throwing more interceptions (five) than touchdowns (two) while completing 73 of 113 passes. His rushing abilities showed promise with 168 yards and a touchdown on 24 carries.

David Helman of Fox Sports captured fans' frustration during the Eagles blowout: "Why isn't Trey Lance finishing this out?" The question gained weight as Cooper Rush struggled throughout the game.

Ad

Many observers puzzle over the Cowboys' handling of Lance. After trading a fourth-round pick to San Francisco in August 2023, Dallas promised special packages for the athletic quarterback. These plans never materialized, leaving Lance behind Rush (and QB1 Dak Prescott) on the depth chart.

Week 18 against Washington now carries extra intrigue. McCarthy enters his final contracted game with his second losing season in Dallas. The decision about Lance's playing time could influence both their futures with the organization.

This quarterback conundrum exemplifies larger questions about Dallas's long-term planning. With Prescott injured and Lance's free agency looming, the Cowboys face crucial decisions about their quarterback room's future direction.

8.title: Lions vs. 49ers Week 17 MNF Injury Report: Latest on Isaac Guerendo, David Montgomery, Charvarius Ward and more
8.snippet: The Detroit Lions and the San Francisco 49ers met in January at Levi's Stadium in the NFC Championship.
8.content:
The Detroit Lions and the San Francisco 49ers met in January at Levi's Stadium in the NFC Championship. The Niners earned a trip to the Super Bowl by stealing a 34-31 victory in that game with an outstanding second-half turnaround.

Ad

The Lions will return to Levi's Stadium for the penultimate game of the 2024 regular season on Monday, hoping to get revenge for that heartbreaking loss from 11 months ago. Detroit (13-2) is vying for the No. 1 seed in the NFC playoffs in order to gain home-field advantage and a first-round bye, while San Francisco (6-9) is no longer in the playoff race this season.

Let's examine both teams' injury reports prior to this eagerly awaited NFC matchup.

Ad

Trending

70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now

Expand Tweet

Ad

Looking to predict NFL playoff Scenarios? Try our NFL Playoff Predictor for real-time simulations and stay ahead of the game!

San Francisco 49ers injury report for MNF

The San Francisco 49ers have been severely shorthanded by injuries to key players this season. They currently have 16 players on the Reserve/Injured list, including running back Christian McCaffrey (PCL), wide receiver Brandon Aiyuk (ACL, MCL), running back Jordan Mason (ankle) and left tackle Trent Williams (ankle).

Coach Kyle Shanahan announced after last week's game against the Miami Dolphins that offensive lineman Jaylon Moore (quad-strain) and left guard Aaron Banks (MCL injury) will not return to action this season.

Ad

On Saturday, the Niners' final injury report had four more players as out: linebacker Dre Greenlaw (calf), cornerback Charvarius Ward (personal matter), guard Spencer Burford (calf) and defensive end Robert Beal (ankle).

Starting right tackle Colton McKivitz (knee) is one of three players ruled as questionable for the game against the Lions. Safety Ji'Ayir Brown (ankle) and linebacker Tatum Bethune (knee) are the other two.

Expand Tweet

Ad

Isaac Guerendo's injury update

RB Isaac Guerendo missed last week’s game against the Dolphins because of foot and hamstring issues. However, he fully practiced on Saturday and has no injury designation for tonight's game against the Lions.

Running backs Jordan Mason (ankle), Elijah Mitchell (hamstring) and Christian McCaffrey (knee) are all on injured reserve for the Niners. This has provided an opportunity for Guerendo to be the team's RB1 until the end of the season.

Ad

Expand Tweet

Ad

Charvarius Ward's injury update

Cornerback Charvarius Ward popped up on the San Francisco 49ers' injury report on Saturday with a DNP designation. However, the team listed him with a "NIR" tag, indicating he was not battling with any injury.

Ward was initially designated as questionable for Week 17, but the team later downgraded him to out for the game against Detroit. Shanahan responded to a question about Ward on Saturday, saying there is nothing to be concerned about.

Ad

"Yeah, stuff I can’t totally share," Shanahan said. "I haven’t talked to him about it, so we’ll keep it personal. But nothing bad happened.”

Expand Tweet

Ad

Detroit Lions injury report for MNF

RB David Montgomery and WR Kalif Raymond are the only players officially ruled out by the Detroit Lions for the game against the Niners, and this didn't come as a surprise.

Montgomery is reportedly not expected to be back to action until the divisional round of the playoffs due to a knee issue.

As for Raymond, he hasn't played since Week 12 due to a foot injury. The Lions ruled him out on their final injury report despite his full week of practice so he won't be activated from injured reserve before Monday Night Football.

Linebacker Jalen Reeves-Maybin, who had a neck injury, was also designated to return from injured reserve last week. However, he has a questionable tag on the final injury report after logging three full practices.

9.title: Detroit Lions vs San Francisco 49ers weather report: Latest on Levi's Stadium conditions for Week 17 MNF showdown
9.snippet: According to Rotowire, the Lions versus 49ers game will be played at 52° F and there's a zero percent chance of rainfall at night.
9.content:
The Detroit Lions and San Francisco 49ers will face off in Week 17 of the NFL regular season at Levi's Stadium. The Lions enter the game assured of postseason qualification, while the 49ers have been eliminated from the playoff picture.

Ad

Before the Monday Night Football game, let's examine the San Francisco 49ers' home stadium weather report.

Expand Tweet

Ad

Trending

70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now

Detroit Lions vs. San Francisco 49ers weather report

According to Rotowire, the Lions versus 49ers game will be played at 52° F and there's a zero percent chance of rainfall at night.

Looking to predict NFL playoff Scenarios? Try our NFL Playoff Predictor for real-time simulations and stay ahead of the game!

Furthermore, there will be a light breeze throughout the ground. The report states that the weather won't have a big effect on the game, and players should be able to perform optimally.

Ad

Expand Tweet

Ad

How are the Lions and 49ers performing this season?

The Detroit Lions enter the game as heavy favorites because of their performance throughout the regular season. They have a 13-2 record, and the only losses this season come against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and Buffalo Bills. Between their losses, they enjoyed an impressive 11-game winning streak.

There are many Lions stars to watch out for, with Jared Goff, Amon-Ra St. Brown, and Jahmyr Gibbs all having Pro Bowl-caliber seasons. All three will start against the 49ers to strengthen their position ahead of next week's "Winner takes first seed" battle against the Minnesota Vikings.

Ad

The 49ers have endured one of the most disappointing seasons among preseason playoff contenders. They've lost nine games and are out of the playoff picture. The 49ers dealt with an array of injuries to key offensive and defensive players, resulting in them missing out on the playoffs for the first time in years.

Hence, Kyle Shanahan's side goes into tonight's game against the Lions to play for pride. Their season was over a few games ago, and they'll now look to retool and potentially come back in 2025 with a different mindset.
